boat.name: Ruby
boat.full_description:
Built 1910, 'Ruby' is a classic half-decker. LOA 22'6" Beam 5'5" Draft 3' she is built in pitch pine on oak, carvel construction. With her classic long 4cwt lead keel she's a very stable dayboat. Extensively restored in 2004-6.

Originally named 'Alan', she was built as a ballasted half decked boat, believed to be similar to a Bembridge Redwing type. She was sheathed in cascover by Tylers of Tunbridge Wells in 1975. She was owned by a Chichester resident for 20 years prior to the 1970's when she was laid up and bought by R.N. Lane. By 1973 she had a small cabin top.

When advertised for sale in 1980 she was described as 'a well cared for and fast boat, won Quiver Trophy (Class 3) in 1973 OGA Solent Annual Race'.

Racing with the OGA on the East Coast during the 1980s she was 2nd in Class 2 in 1982 and first in the class in 1983.
boat.construction_details: Carvel Pitch Pine on Steamed Oak  Keelbolts removed and cascover sheathed 1975 by Tylors of Tunbridge Wells.
boat.short_description: Re-named 'Ruby', this classic half-decker built in 1910 has raced with the OGA since the 1970s when she was called 'Alan'.

for_sales.sales_text:
Built 1910, "Ruby" is a classic half-decker. LOA 22"6' Beam 5"5' Draft 3" she is built in pitch pine on oak, carvel construction. With her classic long 4cwt lead keel she"s a very stable dayboat. Extensively restored in 2004-6.
Cream Dacron Gowen sails in excellent condition. Raymarine Echosounder. Currently ashore near Colchester on a trailer.
